It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, humid forest understories. The plant features broad, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, fragrant white flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds, and the plant is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
